intro: Boissiera pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf boissiera, is a small, evergreen shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, adding a delicate ornamental quality. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture. Boissiera pumilio thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment.
